definition: to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]

sentences.english: For the moment, mind-reading is still science fiction.
sentences.chinese: 目前，读心仍然只存在于科幻小说。

sentences.english: However, the testosterone dose caused a significant reduction in this "mind-reading" advantage amongst the women.
sentences.chinese: 然而，睾酮的剂量明显削弱了女性“读心”的优势。

sentences.english: Mind-reading ability is perhaps the most urgent element of social intelligence.
sentences.chinese: 读心能力也许是社交智力中最重要的元素。

sentences.english: So what does matter to effective mind reading?
sentences.chinese: 那么，对读心来说，有什么是重要的呢？

sentences.english: The joyful sentiments, how to read your heart.
The fortuneteller says that he can read people's minds .
sentences.chinese: 那名算命师说他可以读心。

definition: sixth sense (i.e. intuition, premonition, telepathy etc)
to see through something at first glance (idiom)
to communicate with the spirits/psychic/(ears) sensitive/(information) accurate
see through (a person, scheme, trick etc)
to weigh up sb's words and observe their facial expression (idiom)/to discern what sb thinks from his body language
to shift one's affection/to change sentiment
